Node.gloss: to bear one's guilt|to be punished
Node.definition: = to bear the consequences for an unlawful deed for which one is held responsible

= town; ◄ constructed by king Omri (עָמְרִי) ► capital of northern Israelite (יִשְׂרָאֵל) kingdom until it was conquered by Assyrians (אַשּׁוּר) ≈ often used metonymically to refer to the entire northern kingdom
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
= a person of a young age, usually before puberty
= state in which someone is pregnant

Node.gloss: to be split|to be cleft|to be breached|to be cracked|to be ripped open|to be rent|to burst asunder
Node.definition: = process by which an object is split, either partially or completely, either by supernatural means or by violence

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
literally: to turn (to someone); hence: = action by which humans or deities associate with other humans or deities, often to look for or to provide help and support
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others
= young male bovine; ► clean, used as sacrifice; ≈ associated with power and strength, but also with violence and aggression and therefore often used to denote people who behave as such
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

= large domesticated solid hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot
= action by which humans ride on a domestic animal such as a donkey (חֲמֹור) or a horse (סוּס) or in a chariot (מֶרְכָּבָה)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

Node.gloss: to find mercy|to receive mercy|to obtain mercy
Node.definition: = process by which humans are treated with compassion by others, ► and so be forgiven, spared and/or avoid punishment

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

= causative action by which humans or deities help or cause (other) humans to be restored to health or physical strength after a disease or an accident; this could also refer to the wound or disease itself
= process by which people turning away from someone they had pledged to serve
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

Node.gloss: to turn away|to come to an end|to cease|to subside
Node.definition: literally: (an event) turns away (from someone); hence: = process by which a certain condition comes to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= condensed moisture resulting from contact of air and cooler land surfaces; ►an important source of water for vegetation; ≈ regarded as refreshing, life enhancing; associated with fertility

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone shaped flowers, usually with 5 6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= young branch growing from the stump or stem of a tree or plant

= tree reaching up to 10 m. high, but usually pruned to around 5 m.; its leaves are grayish green above, and whitish underneath; its fruit is about 2 cm. long and a bit more than 1 cm. thick with a hard stone inside and a soft skin that covers the oily flesh; ► its fruit is used for food and oil for cooking, for lamps, for rubbing on the body, for medicine, and for anointing; ≈ regarded as beautiful and associated with well being
= state in which humans, deities, animals and plants are respected by others, implying beauty, vigor and authority
= a distinctive smell, which can be perceived as either pleasant or unpleasant; ≈ sometimes associated with the attitude a certain smell evokes in those who perceive it
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time
= to cause plants or animals to grow to giving them the proper care
= seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
= process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= action by which deities fix their eyes on humans and make sure that no harm will befall them
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

exact meaning unsure: = one of the evergreen trees commonly found in the Lebanon, with round leaves rather than flat; its fruit is a a mostly inedible seed bearing, fleshy cone; ≈ regarded as one of the glorious trees of the Lebanon
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
literally: to be found (in a place); hence: = state in which humans or objects are located in a certain place

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: straight way; = behavior that is morally and ethically right
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= action by which a person or group challenges or defies an authority or agreement
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them
